entry.title: Customer LTSD Issue failing for certain countries
entry.content:
Team,

We implemented the Preference Processing module to be specific the Outbound customer C-LTSD's. We are facing an issue with issuing the LTSD's for two countries SouthKorea(KR) and Serbia. Any LTSD's for Invoices belonging to these two countries, the system is failing to issue the C-LTSD's. We noticed that when creating billing document for Customers from these two countries in the feeder system, the same is not transferring to GTS. In SLG1 we can see the transfer failing with the error - 'Legal Regulation is not Unique'. Message no. /SAPSLL/API_INBOUND060. Diagnosis details of the message says "The legal regulation cannot be determined uniquely for country key DK. Multiple legal regulations are active for country key DK and service of type Customs Processing". However manually transferring the document again via GTS cockpit (/SAPSLL/SD0C_RIMAR3) will transfer the billing document to GTS system and the same is visible in table ‘/SAPSLL/PREBDOC’, my understanding is this is the table from where the billing docs are picked for issuing the LTSD's. But ultimately when issuing the C-LTSD (Tcode - /SAPSLL/LTSDOUT_1) the program fails to issue ..its says '0 LTSDs were created', also the corresponding entry gets deleted from the table ‘/SAPSLL/PREBDOC’. This is a very strange behaviour. Please note that the issue is only faced with Invoices for only countries south Korea and Serbia, rest all countries the system is working as expected. Attached a snapshot of the error in Billing doc transfer. 

Any pointers to solve this issue is highly appreciated. Please note I already  check where there are any multiple country assignments for the Legal Regulations, but did not find any, so that cause can be ruled out. 

 

Thanks,

Dhan

entry.title: Embracing SAP Clean Core: A Strategic Imperative for Digital Transformation
entry.content:
In the rapidly evolving digital landscape, enterprises are constantly seeking ways to streamline operations, enhance agility, and drive innovation. SAP Clean Core emerges as a pivotal strategy in this quest, offering a path to a simplified, efficient, and future-ready enterprise core. This blog post explores the significance of SAP Clean Core, its alignment with SAP Activate methodology, the synergies with RISE with SAP, the transformative capabilities of S/4HANA, and the role of KTern.AI in facilitating this journey.

SAP Activate Methodology: The Blueprint for Success

The SAP Activate methodology is a flexible, agile framework designed to guide businesses through the implementation and deployment of SAP solutions. It encompasses best practices, guided configurations, and a clear methodology to ensure project success. By leveraging SAP Activate, organizations can accelerate their SAP S/4HANA implementations, ensuring a clean core that is devoid of unnecessary customizations and complexity.

RISE with SAP: Elevating Business Transformation

RISE with SAP is a comprehensive offering that simplifies the migration of ERP systems to the cloud. It encapsulates cloud solutions, infrastructure, and services, providing a seamless transition path. With RISE with SAP, businesses can benefit from embedded intelligence, real-time insights, and advanced technologies, all of which contribute to maintaining a clean core and fostering business resilience.

SAP S/4HANA: The Heart of Digital Transformation

At the core of the digital transformation journey lies SAP S/4HANA, SAP’s most advanced ERP suite. Designed to run on the in-memory SAP HANA database, SAP S/4HANA integrates functions from lines of business and industry solutions, offering unparalleled speed, simplicity, and efficiency. A clean core in SAP S/4HANA ensures that businesses can leverage real-time data processing and analytics, essential for informed decision-making and competitive advantage.

 

The Imperative of SAP Clean Core

A clean core is essential for businesses to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics and customer expectations. It enables organizations to leverage the latest SAP product advancements and integrate new software releases promptly. Without a clean core, businesses face challenges such as increased operational costs, inflexibility, and technical debt, which can hinder innovation and growth.

 

 

Without a clean core, organizations may encounter several challenges:

Technical Challenges

  • Complex Upgrades: Customizations can complicate the upgrade process, leading to longer and more costly system updates
  • Reduced System Performance: A cluttered core with custom code can degrade system performance and reliability
  • Increased Technical Debt: Over time, customizations can accumulate, resulting in technical debt that hampers agility and innovation.
  • Integration Difficulties: Custom code can create dependencies that make it difficult to integrate with other systems or technologies.

Operational Challenges

  • Operational Instability: A non-standard core may lead to unpredictable system behavior and increased downtime
  • Compliance Risks: Deviations from standard configurations can pose risks to regulatory compliance and data integrity
  • Resource Intensiveness: Customized systems require more resources for maintenance and support

Strategic Challenges

  • Inhibiting Digital Transformation: A dirty core can hinder an organization’s ability to adapt to new business models and technologies.
  • Barriers to Innovation: Excessive customizations can limit the ability to leverage new SAP functionalities and innovations.
  • Change Management Difficulties: Transitioning to a clean core requires significant change management efforts, which can be challenging if the existing system is heavily customized.

In summary, not maintaining a clean core can lead to increased costs, reduced efficiency, and a lack of flexibility, which are detrimental to an organization’s digital transformation journey. It’s essential to adopt a strategic approach to ensure a clean core for long-term success and sustainability.

Organizations looking to clean up their SAP core can start by adopting a strategic approach that includes the following steps:

  1. Assessment of Customizations: Begin with a thorough assessment of the existing system to identify all customizations, modifications, and enhancement.
  2. Fit-to-Standard Analysis: Evaluate the necessity of each customization against the standard SAP S/4HANA capabilities. Retire any custom code that is no longer needed or can be replaced by standard functionality.
  3. Leverage SAP Best Practices: Adopt SAP best practices and guided configurations to align with standard processes.
  4. Use of SAP BTP for Extensions: Utilize SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) to build extensions rather than modifying the core system.
  5. API-First Approach: Implement an API-first strategy to facilitate integration without altering the core system.
  6. Continuous Monitoring and Optimization: Establish a process for ongoing monitoring and optimization to ensure the core remains clean and aligned with business needs.
  7. Documentation and Governance: Maintain comprehensive documentation of all changes and establish strong governance to manage technical debt.

 

By following these steps, organizations can systematically clean up their SAP core, leading to a more streamlined, efficient, and agile system that is better equipped for the digital transformation journey.

 Accelerating the Journey to a Clean Core with AI powered Automation

KTern.AI stands out as a digital transformation suite that aids in achieving a clean SAP core It offers digital tools for assessment, governance, process orchestration, testing, and optimization. With KTern.AI, businesses can plan risk-free SAP transformations, ensure productive governance, orchestrate SAP process lifecycles, and avoid disruptions during releases.

In conclusion, maintaining a clean core is not just a technical necessity; it is a strategic imperative that underpins the digital transformation journey. By embracing SAP Activate methodology, RISE with SAP, and SAP S/4HANA, and leveraging tools like KTern.AI, businesses can navigate the complexities of digital transformation with confidence and clarity
